name: type
desc:
Type of legend. Optional values:

+ `'plain'`: Simple legend. (default)
+ `'scroll'`: Scrollable legend. It helps when too many legend items needed to be shown.

See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

When `'scroll'` used, these options below can be used for detailed configuration:

+ [legend.scrollDataIndex](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.scrollDataIndex)
+ [legend.pageButtonItemGap](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.pageButtonItemGap)
+ [legend.pageButtonGap](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.pageButtonGap)
+ [legend.pageButtonPosition](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.pageButtonPosition)
+ [legend.pageFormatter](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.pageFormatter)
+ [legend.pageIcons](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.pageIcons)
+ [legend.pageIconColor](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.pageIconColor)
+ [legend.pageIconInactiveColor](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.pageIconInactiveColor)
+ [legend.pageIconSize](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.pageIconSize)
+ [legend.pageTextStyle](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.pageTextStyle)
+ [legend.animation](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.animation)
+ [legend.animationDurationUpdate](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.animationDurationUpdate)

name: id
desc: Component ID, not specified by default. If specified, it can be used to refer the component in option or API.

name: zlevel
desc:
`zlevel` value of all graphical elements in .

`zlevel` is used to make layers with Canvas. Graphical elements with different `zlevel` values will be placed in different Canvases, which is a common optimization technique. We can put those frequently changed elements (like those with animations) to a separate `zlevel`. Notice that too many Canvases will increase memory cost, and should be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid crash.

Canvases with bigger `zlevel` will be placed on Canvases with smaller `zlevel`.

name: z
desc:
`z` value of all graphical elements in , which controls order of drawing graphical components. Components with smaller `z` values may be overwritten by those with larger `z` values.

`z` has a lower priority to `zlevel`, and will not create new Canvas.

name: left
desc:
Distance between legend component and the left side of the container.

`left` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`; and it can also be `'left'`, `'center'`, or `'right'`.

If the `left` value is set to be `'left'`, `'center'`, or `'right'`, then the component will be aligned automatically based on position.

name: top
desc:
Distance between legend component and the top side of the container.

`top` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`; and it can also be `'top'`, `'middle'`, or `'bottom'`.

If the `left` value is set to be `'top'`, `'middle'`, or `'bottom'`, then the component will be aligned automatically based on position.

name: right
desc:
Distance between legend component and the right side of the container.

`right` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`.

Adaptive by default.

name: bottom
desc:
Distance between legend component and the bottom side of the container.

`bottom` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`.

Adaptive by default.

name: width
desc: Width of legend component. Adaptive by default.

name: height
desc: Height of legend component. Adaptive by default.

name: orient
desc:
The layout orientation of legend.

Options:
+ 'horizontal'
+ 'vertical'

name: align
desc:
Legend marker and text aligning. By default, it automatically calculates from component location and orientation. When [left](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.left) value of this component is 'right', and the vertical layout ([orient](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.orient) is 'vertical'), it would be aligned to 'right'.

Option:
+ 'auto'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'

name: padding
desc:
legend space around content. The unit is px. Default values for each position are 5. And they can be set to different values with left, right, top, and bottom.

Examples:
```js
// Set padding to be 5
padding: 5
// Set the top and bottom paddings to be 5, and left and right paddings to be 10
padding: [5, 10]
// Set each of the four paddings seperately
padding: [
5,  // up
10, // right
5,  // down
10, // left
]
```

name: itemGap
desc: The distance between each legend, horizontal distance in horizontal layout, and vertical distance in vertical layout.

name: itemWidth
desc: Image width of legend symbol.

name: itemHeight
desc: Image height of legend symbol.

name: symbolKeepAspect
desc: Whether to keep aspect for icons (from `series.symbol` or user-defined `legend.data.icon`) in the form of `path://`.

name: formatter
selectedMode
desc:
Selected mode of legend, which controls whether series can be toggled displaying by clicking legends. It is enabled by default, and you may set it to be `false` to disable it.

Besides, it can be set to `'single'` or `'multiple'`, for single selection and multiple selection.

name: inactiveColor
desc: Legend color when not selected.

name: selected
textStyle
desc:
Legend text style.





### color(Color)="#fff"

text color.





### fontStyle(string)='normal'

font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`


### fontWeight(string|number)=normal

font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

### fontSize(number)=12

font size.



### align(string)=

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'left'`
+ `'center'`
+ `'right'`



If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
align: right,
rich: {
a: {
// `align` is not set, then it will be right
}
}
}
```




### verticalAlign(string)=

Vertical alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'top'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'bottom'`



If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

children.name: lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.




### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

children.name: rich

+ `'oblique'`

+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...

font family.

font size.

If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:


name: tooltip
desc: Tooltip configuration for legend tooltip, which is similar to [tooltip](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#tooltip).

name: icon
desc:
Icon of the legend items.



Icon types provided by ECharts includes
`'circle'`, `'rect'`, `'roundRect'`, `'triangle'`, `'diamond'`, `'pin'`, `'arrow'`, `'none'`






It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```


Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```

name: data

children.name: name
children.desc: Name of legend, which should be the `name` value of a certain series. If it is a pie chart, legend name can also be the name of a single data item.

children.name: icon
children.desc:
Icon of the legend.



Icon types provided by ECharts includes
`'circle'`, `'rect'`, `'roundRect'`, `'triangle'`, `'diamond'`, `'pin'`, `'arrow'`, `'none'`






It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```


Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```

children.name: textStyle
children.desc: Text style of legend.

name: backgroundColor
desc:
Background color of legend, which is transparent by default.

> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`.

name: borderColor
desc: Border color of legend. Support the same color format as backgroundColor.

name: borderWidth
desc: Border width of legend.

name: borderRadius
desc:
The radius of rounded corner. Its unit is px. And it supports use array to respectively specify the 4 corner radiuses.

For example:
```
borderRadius: 5, // consistently set the size of 4 rounded corners
borderRadius: [5, 5, 0, 0] // (clockwise upper left, upper right, bottom right and bottom left)
```

name: shadowBlur
desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```


**Attention**: This property works only if `show: true` is configured and `backgroundColor` is defined other than `transparent`.

name: shadowColor
desc:
Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.


**Attention**: This property works only if `show: true` configured.

name: shadowOffsetX
desc:
Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.


**Attention**: This property works only if `show: true` configured.

name: shadowOffsetY
desc:
Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.


**Attention**: This property works only if `show: true` configured.

name: scrollDataIndex
desc:
It works when [legend.type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.type) is `'scroll'`.

`dataIndex` of the left top most displayed item.

Although the scrolling of legend items can be controlled by calling `setOption` and specifying this property, we suggest that do not control legend in this way unless necessary (`setOption` might be time-consuming), but just use action [legendScroll](api.html#action.legend.legendScroll) to do that.

See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

name: pageButtonItemGap
desc:
It works when [legend.type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.type) is `'scroll'`.

The gap between page buttons and page info text.

See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

name: pageButtonGap
desc:
It works when [legend.type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.type) is `'scroll'`.

The gap between page buttons and legend items.

See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

name: pageButtonPosition
desc:
It works when [legend.type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.type) is `'scroll'`.

The position of page buttons and page info. Optional values:

+ `'start'`: on the left or top.
+ `'end'`: on the right or bottom.

See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

name: pageFormatter
desc:
It works when [legend.type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.type) is `'scroll'`.

Page info formatter. It is `'{current}/{total}'` by default, where `{current}` is current page number (start from 1), and `{total}` is the total page number.

If `pageFormatter` is a function, it should return a string. The parameters is:
```js
{
current: number
total: number
}
```


See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

name: pageIcons
desc:
It works when [legend.type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.type) is `'scroll'`.

The icons of page buttons.

children.name: horizontal
children.desc:
The icons of page buttons when [legend.orient](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.orient) is `'horizontal'`.

It should be an array, `[previous page button, next page button]`, `['M0,0L12,-10L12,10z', 'M0,0L-12,-10L-12,10z']` by default.

For the each item of the array,



It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```


Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```











See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

children.name: vertical
children.desc:
The icons of page buttons when [legend.orient](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.orient) is `'vertical'`.

It should be an array, `[previous page button, next page button]`, `['M0,0L20,0L10,-20z', 'M0,0L20,0L10,20z']` by default.

For the each item of the array,



It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```


Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```











See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

name: pageIconColor
desc:
It works when [legend.type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.type) is `'scroll'`.

The color of page buttons.

See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

name: pageIconInactiveColor
desc:
It works when [legend.type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.type) is `'scroll'`.

The color of page buttons when they are inactive.

See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

name: pageIconSize
desc:
It works when [legend.type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.type) is `'scroll'`.

The size of page buttons. It can be a number, or an array, like `[10, 3]`, represents `[width, height]`.

See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

name: pageTextStyle
desc:
It works when [legend.type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.type) is `'scroll'`.

The text style of page info.







### color(Color)=#333

text color.





### fontStyle(string)='normal'

font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`


### fontWeight(string|number)=normal

font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

### fontSize(number)=12

font size.

children.name: lineHeight
width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.




### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

name: animation
desc: Whether to use animation when page scrolls.

name: animationDurationUpdate
desc: Duration of the page scroll animation.

children.name: selectorLabel
children.desc: > Since `v4.4.0`

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element. Works when position is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc:
Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.








#### color(Color)="#fff"

text color.




If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









#### fontStyle(string)='normal'

font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`


#### fontWeight(string|number)=normal

font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


#### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

#### fontSize(number)=12

font size.



#### align(string)=

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'left'`
+ `'center'`
+ `'right'`



If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
align: right,
rich: {
a: {
// `align` is not set, then it will be right
}
}
}
```




#### verticalAlign(string)=

Vertical alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'top'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'bottom'`



If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

children.name: lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




#### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








#### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








#### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

#### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

#### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

#### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

#### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

#### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

#### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


#### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









#### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

#### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

#### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

#### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

#### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

The text label style of the selector button, which is displayed by default.

##### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

##### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

##### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

##### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


##### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









##### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

##### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

##### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

##### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

##### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

name: selectorPosition
desc:
> Since `v4.4.0`




The position of the selector button, which can be placed at the end or start of the legend component, the corresponding values are `'end'` and `'start'`. By default, when the legend is laid out horizontally, the selector is placed at the end of it, and when the legend is laid out vertically, the selector is placed at the start of it.

name: selectorItemGap
desc:
> Since `v4.4.0`




The gap between the selector button.

name: selectorButtonGap
desc:
> Since `v4.4.0`




The gap between selector button and legend component.
